description: From New Latin cohobātus, past participle of cohobāre, perhaps from Arabic [script needed] (ka`aba, “to repeat an action”) or [script needed] (qohba, “brownish color”).

verbs.description: cohobate (third-person singular simple present cohobates, present participle cohobating, simple past and past participle cohobated)

entries.meaning: (chemistry, alchemy) To treat a material with a boiling liquid and repeatedly return the distillate.
